website_summaries.verdict: The plates, bowls, and coffee cups are double-fired red enamel with plastic handled steel cutlery.
pros: These are full sized, 10-inch dinner plates and 12-ounce coffee mugs
The 6-inch bowls have room to spare also
Everything is dishwasher safe for easy cleaning when you get back home
The cutlery has its own roll-up storage pouch
cons: There needs to be a separate carrying case or bag for the plates, bowls, and coffee mugs

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware: eat the paint.
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand. But this is the first time I've had problems with it. We got two sets and the red enamel is chipping off the mugs, bowls, and plates. After 2-3 uses and hand-washed. Flatware is perfect! It's nice (or not) to look down in your cup and see red paint floating around. Buyer beware! I don't recommend this at all! But the flatware is fine!
customer_reviews.author: BuyAlot

customer_reviews.title: Horrible junk
customer_reviews.text: As shown in the pictures I have attached to this product, out of the box the product had huge production issues.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Unusable Dishes
customer_reviews.text: The dish set was purchased for camping and I wasn't expecting much, but what came was not usable. The enamel has missing spots from several of the pieces and those spots are corroded badly. The attached picture was taken "out of the box". Coleman, you should be ashamed. Returned the item through Amazon. That part was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: BOYD M COWLEY

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful dishes, but one cup severely damaged
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get these dishes ... and then I opened up the cups and found that one of them was severely damaged. I tried ordering a replacement - but then realized that they weren't going to get to me in enough time, so I tried to cancel the replacement order. I still don't know if I succeeded. But, I need some camping dishes ... I'm going to have to order something. I'm so sad, because these are Coleman and they're really beautiful - but ...........
customer_reviews.author: CyndiAnn

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointing , typical poor Chinese quality, not American made.
customer_reviews.text: Opened the set today after receiving it After inspections ALL flat dishes have enamel chipped of in 1 or 2 places , 1 cup enamel chipped off on inside; 1 of the bowls has also issues. It is ridiculous - we haven't even used it yet. Our old blue set lasted for more then 10 years and this replacement is in nowhere even close in quality. By the way the cups are small size, not large - which is not pointed out in description. Not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: LZ

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful red enameled finish.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for camping. It is a beautiful set, the finish was nice on top. The edges and under the edge were not as nice as we hoped for. Cleaning them over time we figured they would not give us confidence of a clean bacteria free plate. The bowls & cups seemed a bit better. We passed them on to a couple that wasn't as concerned about those issues. Otherwise I would have given 5 stars for sealed edges.
customer_reviews.author: Grannie Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great comes in colors.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find a set in colors. Everyone buys the blue. So if our family goes with others. Don't want our mixed in with theirs. Since most people buy the generic blue color sold at most stores. Only downside is there's no carry bag at all. So i'm going to have to get a carry bag or tote for it. A recommendation is with any porcelain coted dinnerware always buy a set of cheap washcloths. Store one between each dish in a firmly fitting container unless you want them to get all marked up clanking around in the bags. I know this from our last set they got all chipped up during travels. so live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Mamabear C.

customer_reviews.title: Hip Enamelware! Utensils Not Durable though
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely ADORE the enamel plates, bowls, and mugs. I love the color and speckled enamel. The bowls are a tad small (you can't fit a whole can of soup in them). The one downside is the utensils- the tops pop out of the red base, and I was trying to scrap something out of a jar with a spoon and the red plastic cracked in half. Don't expect the utensils to be super durable, but the rest is so great.
customer_reviews.author: ESiews

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment! Chipped up even before we ever used them
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read the reviews ahead of time. We were loading them in the camper, one cup fell on the floor and chipped up as shown in the picture. What a bunch of garbage. Coleman should be ashamed at selling such trash. I used to feel that if I purchased a Coleman branded item it was of good quality. It's time to ditch any new purchases of their products I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lafollette

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as it used to be! The enamel is thin. First time using it, got a chip when it slipped out of my hands and dropped onto the floor while drying dishes. The cups are pretty small. I like the big cups you can wrap your mittens around when it's cold at night.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Girot

customer_reviews.title: worked great for a few trips.
customer_reviews.text: the plates, cups and bowls work great but the silverware is sub par. both a spoon and fork broke in half from standard use. the silverware is NOT full tang as it is meant to look. the tang stops after the hilt, the rest is plastic. Very disappointing. I expected better from Coleman. Seems there quality has gone in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and exceptional price!
customer_reviews.text: Enamel crockery is always the best for camping and these are great. They feel nice to eat off and drink out of and the enamel does insulate them a bit. I've used straight stainless steel plates before and they get so hot you can't put them on your lap. As for the cutlery, I thought they looked crap and had planned to get others later. But I sliced my finger open on a knife just taking them out of the wrapping! So they're definitely sharp enough. They're actually sturdy and really good quality too. It's a fantastic set and the price was what I'd expect to pay for a cheap plastic set. I'm extremely happy! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Nomnom

customer_reviews.title: but were severely disappointed when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to see the Coleman brand on a lightning deal, but were severely disappointed when it arrived! This is not the quality I remember growing up with in this brand. There were several chips and it was evident that they were poorly manufactured. We returned the set hoping it was a fluke, but the replacement order had even more chips. Thanks to Amazon being wonderful, we returned both and received a full refund. Unfortunately Coleman does not appear to be the go-to brand any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany BZ

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Not as great as I'd expected.. the silverwear is complete crap as I'd figured.. but honestly the rest of the set is somewhat cheaply done as well. Many places chipped... and I imagine they will rust early. Can't get things like this like you used to that would be tough and last forever.. to much crap on the market
customer_reviews.author: Angela Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Chips easily.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for our RV. My husband and I have used the dishes and mugs 4 times on 3 and 4 day trips. The mugs already have large chips on the rims. One of the bowls has a chip on the side. I wash them by hand and they are stored in the cabinet in between trips. The silverware is pretty but flimsy. The spoons are almost flat. I can't imagine eating soup with them. I probably will end up buying other dishes in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Jantzi

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived in good condition. Was skeptical about some of the other reviews about chips but all of mine were fine. UPDATE: took them out this weekend on a camping trip. Worked great. The spoon is a little large for little kids. Other than that, clean up is easy and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Paint flakes But They Work
customer_reviews.text: They looked great. Love the red. But the enamel chips off so much easier than my older set. Not sure if its because the color is made differently, or Colemans quality has went down a lot. They work as they should, and outside of paint they are durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jose D.

customer_reviews.title: These are great for camping
customer_reviews.text: These are great for camping. Easy to use and clean. The silverware doesn't fall apart and is made well. The knives are sharp enough to cut steak, which is great so we don't have to bring another set of knives. I like the case the silverware comes in because it makes it easier for me to stay organized on the trip. Now if I could just get everyone to put their silverware in the case rather than me doing it, that would be great.
customer_reviews.author: LisaLouWho

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money. Learn from me instead.
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible plates and utensils. The plates and bowls all chipped - we have only been camping twice. They were gently used. But a single place down at a slight angle and a large chunk of enamel would come off. And the utensils! So cheap, stamped poorly, spoons so flat they could barely hold soup, and sharp edges! Ugh. I bought too early before actual use so I can't return, and hopefully this review will send someone looking elsewhere. Regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: N. Black

customer_reviews.title: Great set for camping.
customer_reviews.text: Great set for camping. I grew up with a dish set just like this. The enamel has a couple very small chips in it but since this is a camping dish set it’s nothing too much to worry about. I love that the silverware has a carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Burrier

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set, Worth Buying for Camping or Trips
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice set. I bought the red set to keep at our property as we don't have a home there and so we typically cook food over or in the fire. These are a great quality, are easy for me to clean with no running water, and are perfect for what we need. I am not worried about them breaking and they are pretty which is a great bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Collyn Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Chipped Enamel right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: The inexpensive plastic handled flatware is the highest quality part of this set. You read that right. Inexpensive plastic handles aren't high quality to begin with. I found the same problems as many other reviewers have found with the enamel being chipped from the get go. There is definitely a lack of quality in the production of these dishes. I would not use a knife on these dishes at all! I use them when camping and like the fact that these are lighter weight than corelle but wish I had gone for the red and white corelle dishes instead. They will last longer than these!
customer_reviews.author: Paula B Campin

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous junk
customer_reviews.text: The only saving grace of this set is the silverware carrier. The silverware included is useful and dishwasher safe but similar to what can be had for $5 or less elsewhere. The dishes in the set I received were horribly malformed. The edge of the plates were not rolled properly and sharp enough in points that we never even tried using them. The bowls had grit between the metal and the enamel and this causes bumps and bubbles in the top surface that forms cracks, and chips the enamel. In short, this looks like someone at Coleman decided to put the production line mistakes on Amazon while selling the better items elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Dain

customer_reviews.title: Not so hot
customer_reviews.text: I returned this. I am giving this product 1 star because I liked the silverware that came with it. I was really disappointed in the enamel ware. On several pieces, after a single use, the enamel popped off and the bare metal was exposed. This shouldn't happen. Coleman needs to look at the source that is making these in China and maybe think about bringing them back to the USA. I would gladly pay double for these if they were as good as they used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Verginia

customer_reviews.title: Love this kit
customer_reviews.text: Love this kit, great quality, nice utensils, and works great for camping. Just with it came with a case or better box as my box got wet and is falling apart. I like to try to keep things that come in boxes is the boxes if possible otherwise I tend to lose things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 year update, originally Happy Overall
customer_reviews.text: Update 4 years later - I expected more durability from Coleman. Two of the cups and one bowl have rusted through the enamelware. A pretty good set for what you get. Silverware - We used this summer quite a bit. The knives are almost too sharp, but I am sure they will dull over time. Dishware - It is made of metal, keep it out of the microwave. It did not chip over the summer. - a Star because it is metal. I saw many negative reviews and held off on mine to see how it did. Overall... Happiness
customer_reviews.author: Average Jim

customer_reviews.title: I really like this set
customer_reviews.text: I really like this set. I was a little disappointed that some of the pieces looked a little worn, but it is still perfect for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Despite some bad reviews, my set was perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Just received everything and NO CHIPS lol I started reading the reviews after I bought them and was kinda worried but the box came unopened and everything looked great.
customer_reviews.author: ursula h

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my neice
customer_reviews.text: I sent these to my niece for her college apartment. She liked them. But, later did a lead test because the enamel was coming off and I felt so bad, I ended up getting her a bamboo set of utensils and tableware. Full set of everything she needed. Much more healthier and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: chipped upon delivery like so many others
customer_reviews.text: chipped upon delivery like so many others... The mailing package was fine, it is the way the manufacturer boxed the dishes up with very little padding that led to the pieces bumping into each other all of the way from china and to your door in the original Coleman box. If they packed them better from the factory these would be like any other enamel campware.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Pretty poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty poor quality product. The plates have many spots where the enamel wasn't applied correctly, so you can see where a worker brushed on red paint to hide it. The forks and spoons are flat. Yes, flat. No way you could use the spoons to eat anything except really think mashed potatoes or something. Rubbish. I kept the set just because the bowls and plates where serviceable for camping. The silverware isn't bad enough to throw away, but it isn't good enough to use (forks and spoons) the knives aren't bad, but as a set, they just don't work. But this set cheap and then get silverware from REI.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Caton

customer_reviews.title: I like the nice bright red
customer_reviews.text: This set works well enough. I like the nice bright red, instead of the usual blue. I was surprised at how quickly the cups began to chip. They have been used for less than a year at our cabin, and three of the four cups have a lot of chipping on the edges. The plates and bowls have held up well so far. The knives are far sharper than we realized, and I cut myself pretty well just getting one out of the case.
customer_reviews.author: anonymom

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on Amazon and used them this past weekend during a camping trip. They held up well. The knives cut thick steaks with no problem and the plates didn't scratch. The coffee cups worked great and the bowls held the salad, fruit and cereal like they were supposed to do. The dishes are metal with enamel over them. The one downfall was having to remove the "Made in China" stickers off of every dish prior to use. So now I have a fear of lead poisoning. I wish I had known prior to purchasing, I would've searched for a brand that was "Made in the USA". Minus 1 star for not being made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Sickpup94

customer_reviews.title: Chips easily
customer_reviews.text: Chipped out of the box and continued to chip while camping. Only used the cups and now can't return because it's past the window (because I was camping). Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jen R. Stiling

customer_reviews.title: cute but the enamel comes off
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to find a dining kit that looks just like this one but is made somewhere other than China (USA maybe?) and that has an enamel coating that doesn't self-destruct. Over the course of two- count 'em, 2- camping trips, the enamel on all bowls and mugs developed chips and began peeling. The flatware didn't come apart but is made of cheap bendy metal so you have to be careful not to break it. I ended up with a functional useful flatware pouch, bendy flatware and some plates for the cost of the Dining Kit- I'm sure someone out there would consider that a good deal but I do not.
customer_reviews.author: bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Good camping set
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We've brought these on about 4 camping trips now and they wash up super easy. We do avoid putting them in the dish washer when we get home just due to notes about enamel chipping and as a result they still look new. Only complaint is that the mugs get VERY hot for coffee but that's kind of the price you pay with enamel.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Decker

customer_reviews.title: Love the red color.
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I have carpel tunnel in both hands .I tend to drop and break alot of dishes when the pain shoots up my hand.Not with these I will never break them.
customer_reviews.author: Beck

customer_reviews.title: I am greatly satisfied in that I don't have to order prepared foods ...
customer_reviews.text: While made in such a way as not to break, I am already beginning to notice the paint or coating on, at least, one plate beginning to chip a little. Otherwise, I am greatly satisfied in that I don't have to order prepared foods anymore - as I am now more able to cook, prepare, and eat my own foods without spending too much money. Thank you for providing a much needed service!
customer_reviews.author: kurt slotkowski

customer_reviews.title: Junk, Junk, Junk. Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: This set looked promising but I was sadly disappointed by the poor quality. This is not the same enamelware that you might remember when you were a kid. The enamel coating is very thin and uneven, and easily chipped. One mug and one plate arrived in the package severely chipped to the point of being unusable. I would have been satisfied to be able to just purchase individual matching replacements rather than deal with the hassle of returning the set, but Coleman does not offer them individually. Lesson learned here: you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Konsumer

customer_reviews.title: knives are sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Great set for camping. Nice to have the silverware keeper, but it doesn't work great. And heads up the knives are quite sharp - not for kids.
customer_reviews.author: ceedub620

customer_reviews.title: Great set. Some of our items came damaged in ...
customer_reviews.text: Great set. Some of our items came damaged in the set and had to be thrown away but the remaining did fine and was easy to clean. The silverware holder is handy but can be difficult to get the silverware back in because of the tension on the elastic.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap China grade. Do not buy. Fork broke ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap China grade. Do not buy. Fork broke in half without any force made. Only used twice. Its basically plastic. Fake steel.
customer_reviews.author: ChristS

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This set is amazing ! I use it some times as dinner ware and we are not camping. The color is vibrant, durable and easy to clean. HIGHLY Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the "Coleman" standard
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness Amazon is great about returns! Please don't be fooled by the Coleman name. Whoever is producing these for Coleman has quality control issues in the factory. I received a set with several obvious manufacturing errors. Enamel melted off the entire side of a cup, broken and chipped pieces, etc. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.W.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: I take very good care of these, washing them by hand and drying carefully after each use! They are exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: I just would have expected them to start in better condition and get dinged up over time with use
customer_reviews.text: Some of the plates are missing enamel in spots and one of the forks is missing the metal screw/grommets but all in all they serve the purpose since they're for camping. I just would have expected them to start in better condition and get dinged up over time with use.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C Davis

customer_reviews.title: Cups Arrived chipped
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used the set yet but when I opened the box the cups were all chipped. Doesn’t make me confident in the durability
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Thin Enamel
customer_reviews.text: I think this item is a great thing when going camping. I like how the silverware is kept together. My problem with it is that in manufacturing, the enamel was laid sooooo thin that it missed 3 spots on one of the cups and nearly missed a spot on another cup and plate. Otherwise I would give it a five star rating. Love the color. Immediately, upon asking for a replacement, a new one was in the mail. It had a much better enamel pouring. We are very satisfied with the new one. There were no missed spots on the whole set. So I upped my rating to a five star.
customer_reviews.author: C. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this item. The picture doesn’t show the white dots throughout the design which was misleading and the items are not microwaveable because the plates and cups are made of a tin material.
customer_reviews.author: kalima foster

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure that I would find any use for this dining kit, but wanted something in Tanzania to take on picnics to wonderful spots. So, got this set. The only thing I wish was that they had a cute container of some sort, but the flatwear is in a cute windup case so no losses there. But, the rest of the kit is really nice. It won't break, it cleans easily, you can see it in the grass and dirt, and everything is a good size. Just the ticket for picnics. Coleman definitely knows what they are doing. Now they need to make it with a traveling case for the whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ngirilover

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love Coleman cookware for camping. This set is just what we were looking for! It's durable and will last us a long time. I love that it came with a case for all the silverware, when your camping you want to pack as little as possible and this set makes it easy to keep track of everything.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great camping set.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find the enamelware these days, and this set was great. I wish that it had a little carry case to pack it all up into instead of just for the cutlery but so far, they have been great. I put them through their paces and I foresee them lasting our scouting family a nice long time. I would buy it again. Mugs are decent sized too and the knives cut meat nicely.
customer_reviews.author: S. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for college apartment
customer_reviews.text: My Son loved this set. It's perfect for his college apartment and he love to camp and hike as well so they will be used for manyany years.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping!
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping, easy to clean, have all you needed for 4 persons. The bad, Not for microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Medina

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this set! Great addition to my camping gear! Quality is nice, the same as any enamelware you get now a days. ALL enamelware chips if not taken care of. Other reviews say it chips easy. I used mine camping this week and there is not 1 chip! Arrived in perfect condition and still is. Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Cups burn your hand with coffee
customer_reviews.text: The cups will burn your hand with coffee in them. I thought they were super cute so I purchased them for the camper but just hate the cups.
customer_reviews.author: mindy schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and noisy.
customer_reviews.text: This product is soooo bad. Maybe 100-years ago it was all the rage, but not today. The knives are super sharp. I'll give them that. But the knives, forks, etc. are really cheap, stamped metal that rusts! The handles are barely attached to the steel. The plates, bowls, etc. are cheap and really noisy; something you don't want at the campsite. It's just really cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Vernazzait

customer_reviews.title: They are really light weight and not quite what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I like the set, one of the cups came chipped, I gave away the cups and silverware and kept the plates and bowls. I hope they will last, after seeing the chipped cup, I am hoping the rest will not end up like the cup. We shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Letty

customer_reviews.title: Chipping
customer_reviews.text: Received the items and was highly disappointed when they were scratched terribly and the enamel was chipping off. I also noticed that the cups were not properly sealed with the enamel. While I understand mistakes happen, it is very unfortunate for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BBR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camp set!
customer_reviews.text: These are bright and cheery to use while camping! Love 'em!
customer_reviews.author: Drumgal

customer_reviews.title: Best camping set for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great setup for camping. Coleman high quality. Nice utensil case. Big plates, nice size bowls and coffee cups. Enamel coating extremely durable. Should last for many years! Wish it came with case....
customer_reviews.author: Alicia MTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Buy plastic. Or anything else.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. It chips itself sitting in my camper drawer. Which then rusts. I have already thrown out half the kit. In two months. Also, the metal transfers heat so quickly(I guess it should be obvious) it burns your hand, then chills your food. Silverware is flat and difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: bovine0001

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these and got another as a gift. The plates are heavy. Stand up to wind and rain and being bounced around camping. The roll keeps everything clean and in one place. It will last a long time and it looks nice doing so...
customer_reviews.author: Shana Bailliez

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: Good, one of the cups was wrecked from getting beat around in transport. I am in the Army, and use this in my barracks. Works great for that application. Would probably serve a college student, or a new camper well. Just make sure you give it a good wash when you first get it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice package for price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a pop up camper and it has worked perfectly. Easy to clean. Unbreakable enamel plates. The silver ware could use some improvements but works perfect for a camper or car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Took a Chance
customer_reviews.text: Reading the reviews here, this item seems a bit of a gamble, but I took the chance because it was otherwise right for what I needed--dinnerware on our 30 foot sailboat where galley space is very tight. The dinnerware arrived in good condition exactly as shown in the picture with no visible defects. (I would have preferred black handles on the utensils but red is ok.) It is good for lightweight portability somewhere in between paper plates and regular dishes. Four stars because it feels pricey for enamel-coated metal dinnerware and the overall quality is good but not amazing. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: William Mains

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother!
customer_reviews.text: Enamel chips off and then rusts. Only used the product 2 times before it started chipping and rusting. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Chipped enamel
customer_reviews.text: The enamel was chipped off several of the items when package arrived. The package was not damaged and you could tell it was packaged damaged because the packaging around the items inside the box was not damaged either. Also says made in China. Not exactly pleased. And I typically like Coleman products. I returned it today same day I received it.
customer_reviews.author: LittleFishy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Nostalgia Campingware
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Wish they came with more permanent packing materials for travel. The mugs get HOT! After a couple weekends of use there are a couple dings on them, but not bad at all. Seem pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi in NC

customer_reviews.title: Yeah.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift to my daughter and it is just like the set I bought 12 yrs ago ( maybe better) she loves it and that is what matters .
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, durable, great set!
customer_reviews.text: Great for travel, we used these on our camping trip and they were super easy to clean, I was super impressed with the quality for the cost. It was nice to have an entire set.
customer_reviews.author: littlesmom

customer_reviews.title: A must buy for camping
customer_reviews.text: Great product much better than Using paper plates and plastic utensils and throwing them away
customer_reviews.author: Rwd

customer_reviews.title: Find another product....
customer_reviews.text: This is not the Coleman quality products we expected. We have some cups that are probably 50+ years old and they have never chipped like these did. They are poorly made and any contact with the counter causes them to chip. We haven't even gotten them out to the motor home to use and they are damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Enamel might chip?
customer_reviews.text: Simple camp dinnerware set. Everything seems to be perfectly sized and worked well for family camping. Wished it came in a bag or carrier but the flatware holder is handy for transport. 2 cups arrived with chipped enamel. I assume this came directly from manufacturing this way as there was no indication it occurred in shipping. The non-damaged items should hold up for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Spotty Enamel Coverage
customer_reviews.text: Several pieces are missing enamel. Disappointed, as I went camping and didn't open box till out at the campsite, otherwise I would have returned. Otherwise, very heavy material.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: good essentials set
customer_reviews.text: This is a good essentials set to have for two people. Very light and sturdy. The downsides are that the spoons are very shallow so they dont hold much liquid, they dont hold heat at all so you have to be careful holding cups and putting plates on your lap, and they get surprisingly hot sitting on a table in the 70 degree heat. I may end up springing for one of the other kits made by MSR or GSI, but for now this kit will work just fine and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Inbound

customer_reviews.title: No quality control
customer_reviews.text: For what it is, it is good. Utensils feel a little cheap. The one reason it is marked down is that some of the blemishes are pretty severe. One cup out of the four is not usable and had to be thrown away (see image I uploaded). I wish we could buy a set like this that was made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Randy E. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Have taken the set camping with us twice and has held up great! Only wish it came with a nice reusable carrying case! So nice not having to worry about buying plastic plates,bowls,forks,spoons,knives and cups every time we go camping! A lot less wasteful too! I have a feeling I will have this set for a long long long time and would definitely recommend buying a set!
customer_reviews.author: erica

customer_reviews.title: Love this set
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of these plates...one was nice, but I wanted another set so I didn't have to constantly be doing dishes while camping. Love them and much better than having to use paper products.
customer_reviews.author: gmu20

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for an upcoming camping trip. I have not used them yet, but I will say, these are good quality. The enamel is smooth and lightweight. This set is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Relly Donut

customer_reviews.title: MMMMM TIME TO EAT!
customer_reviews.text: These came in handy for my weekend camping trip! Easy to clean and very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Another Customer

customer_reviews.title: These look like the old style that lasted decades
customer_reviews.text: The first one came with several pieces already chipped. I can see on the replacements areas that have been painted over that were chipped. These look like the old style that lasted decades, but they are no where near the same quality. Think of them as long lasting paper plates.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Silverware less than stellar - package incomplete in box
customer_reviews.text: The silverware set was incomplete - instead four forks I got three, and in its place an extra knife was placed in the satchel. It almost makes it worse that they included an extra knife -- it means whoever was putting it together at the factory knew a fork was missing but didn't care. Also one of the spoons is badly bent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enalemed Dining Set-camping
customer_reviews.text: Very fast delivery and arrived in a quality shipping box. No damages and was well packed. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was due to the flatware having plastic handles. If they were heavier duty handles this would have been a very durable set. Time will tell how the handles hold up on the flatware, but the dishes were just what we were looking for. Nice sizes and will be great in elk camp next fall.
customer_reviews.author: K. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Plates are good, the silverware sucks
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the plates bowls and cups I give those a five-star. But the silverware is huge. The spoons and forks are pretty big the knives are basically semi sharp butter knives. If you got anything hard to cut through like a steak I wish you luck.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: They DO chip
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to the reviews that say they chip, they are right. Only used twice, and 3 of the 4 cups are badly chipped around the rim. Most of the chipping.occurred while stored. One of the bowls has started to chip and the plates are starting to bubble. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Pate

customer_reviews.title: This set is amazing. Love the color
customer_reviews.text: This set is amazing. Love the color...love the way the cup feels in my hand. Love how easy they are to clean. Perfect for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Poetivity

customer_reviews.title: Low quality to the point of being unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I went for a better quality product. One cup came badly damaged. The others are likely not far behind. Unfortunately I unwrapped it just before leaving on a camping trip and need them so I can’t return them, but they’ll all be in the trash in a few weeks and I’ll have to buy another set. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: It is well made and functions wonderfully. It is nice and compact which makes storing ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to put in my tent trailer. It is well made and functions wonderfully. It is nice and compact which makes storing it easy. It has saved us from buying tons of paper products that will just be thrown out. They are easy to use and especially easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Trussell

customer_reviews.title: Always have loved enamel ware. These are great.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my travel trailer. They are not to heavy and clean up easily. Heavy duty and great for camping or just having in a home with accident prone residents. I believe Coleman also sells these in blue
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Returning for Bad Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'd read the mixed reviews. I really like the design, so I took the chance maybe ours would be in better shape than some others have reported. Nope. Lots of chips in the enamel out of the box, and even places on the mug handles where the enamel just doesn't cover the metal at all. Still looking for a good solution for a camp kitchen . . . .
customer_reviews.author: bebemama

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait for summer
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I now do a lot of 'civilized' car camping. I have spent a lifetime mountaineering/adventure hiking, and using everything from tin cans and up, to cook in and eat out of. This item caught my eye and I had to have it. Received item quickly and it is very very nice. Heavy gauge, excellent finish, and very attractive. Can now retire all our mismatched plates, cups & flatware, and have a nice tidy set of matched dishes. These will look pretty sharp on our camp dining table.
customer_reviews.author: Milwood

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient and Basic
customer_reviews.text: The silverware packet is more useful that the dishware itself. Two of the cups came with the enamel chipped in a few spots. The plates, cups, and bowls are more "tinny" than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth it, I have used these for several camping trips and its every thing you could need.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Bevelacqua

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but heavy...one issue...
customer_reviews.text: I like that they are red with white spots... overall, pretty much what I expected for the price I paid. However, one mug has a corrosion spot (see picture). I've had the set less than 10 days and haven't used once. All the other pieces seem to be ok. On the fence on sending back, mainly because I already tossed the box. Would I order again? Nope... would I recommend? Nope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: So nice to have reusable dishes that are strong and nice to look at. We have taken these camping several times and they still look like new. Love the silverware and it's all very compact. Thank you Coleman for these wonderful dishes. I hated using paper plates, plastic fork etc. I hated how much room the disposable stuff took up. Now we have a green space saving solution! I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: No bag
customer_reviews.text: This is for camping and so many pieces which makes it difficult to manage without a bag.Some items are chipped and haven't even used it yet,do you have a touch up paint and can it be applied at this point in time ?
customer_reviews.author: srepko

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pack easy to unpack very cleanable great set of utensils
customer_reviews.text: Great set of dishes I intend to buy another set so I have a placesetting for eight of us
customer_reviews.author: Russell Dear

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: Great set of dinnerware. We used it while camping and although we only have a family of three it was really nice to have the fourth set so if (when) my son ended up dropping something we had a back up for it. Live the carrying case for the silverware so we didn't have silverware just sliding around everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W

customer_reviews.title: Easy to eat with this set
customer_reviews.text: Loved this set for our most recent camping trip in California. Easy to clean, takes up minimal space, and the perfect size for all of our meals.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

product_meta.title: Coleman 24-Piece Enamel Dinnerware Set, Red
product_meta.description:
Serve up your favorite foods around the campfire or portable stove with the Coleman 24-Piece Enamel Dinnerware Set. Made of double-fired enamel and featuring a timeless red speckled design, this outdoor dinnerware set offers classic style and durability and is dishwasher safe for easy cleaning. This 24-piece set includes four 10-inch dinner plates, four 12-ounce coffee mugs with handles, and four 6-inch bowls, making it a great choice for family meals at picnics, BBQs, and campsites. It also includes a silverware kit with four plastic-handled forks, spoons, and knives stored in a convenient roll-up pouch for easy organization and storage.

AMAZON.COM
Ideal for camping, picnicking, and even backyard use, this set of Coleman speckled dinnerware includes everything you need to eat a meal under the stars. The 24-piece set is outfitted with four 10-inch dinner plates, four 10-ounce mugs, and four 6-inch bowls, giving you and three co-campers enough containers for a main course, a side salad, and an after-dinner hot chocolate. In addition, the set comes with four knives, four spoons, and four forks, so you don't need to rely on plastic silverware when eating. Best of all, the set is durable and dishwasher-safe, with a red-speckled enamel surface that holds up to heavy use. The silverware also includes a compact carrying case to keep the cutlery bunched together.

 About Coleman
The Coleman Company has been creating and innovating products for recreational outdoor use since W.C. Coleman started selling gasoline-powered lanterns in 1900. Inventor of the hugely popular fold-up camp stove, Coleman developed a plastic liner for his galvanized steel coolers in 1957--the birth of the modern cooler--and the company has been improving their utility and design ever since. The array of products that bear the Coleman name now includes just about everything you might need to work or play outdoors, from tents and sleeping bags to boats, backpacks, and furniture.
feature_bullets: Classic outdoor dinnerware set ideal for camping and picnics
Durable, double-fired enamelware with a timeless red speckled design
Includes 4 dinner plates, 4 coffee mugs, and 4 bowls
Silverware kit includes 4 plastic-handled forks, spoons, and knives in a roll-up pouch

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
